intro: Pleurothallis microtis, commonly known as the miniature orchid, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a small epiphytic orchid that typically grows on trees in humid, shaded environments. The plant features delicate, linear leaves and produces tiny, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale pink. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated by orchid enthusiasts. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is relatively challenging to grow outside of its natural range.
